page.title: 01OUR AREA _ SKELMERSDALE
page.content: Skelmersdale is a New Town built around an old mining community. As you enter Skelmersdale you are surrounded by countryside but when you arrive in the town itself you see a mixture of new housing estates,industrial areas and the older mining houses.There are lots of schools in the town,both primary and comprehensive.Most of the schools,like the houses,have been built in the last 15 years. There are also lots of open spaces in and around the town.The main and biggest one is the Trim Trail and Tawd Valley. The 'River Tawd' flows through the Trim Trail. At one time Viking ships are said to have sailed down it, but now it is no more than 2 metres wide. Farmland and the tiny village of Westhead make up the rest of this Domesday block.
